page.title: 06APPLEDINE BROOK
page.content: APPLEDINE BROOK THE STREAM FLOWS S.E. FROM RENHOLD AND RAVENSDEN TOWARDS THE GREAT OUSE RIVER.IT VARIES IN DEPTH FROM 5CM.TO 50CM. SOMETIMES THERE ARE DEEP POOLS AND IN OTHER PLACES THERE IS BARELY A TRICKLE OF WATER. DURING SEVERAL WEEKEND VISITS IN LATE SPRING I SAW COWSLIPS AND BLUEBELLS ALONG THE BANKS. ALTOGETHER I SAW 2 STICKLEBACKS,A MINNOW, ROACH, A DACE AND SMALL CHUBB. ALTHOUGH IT IS SO CLOSE TO THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE THERE ARE MANY BIRDS TO BE SEEN. AS WELL AS THRUSHES,BLACKBIRDS AND SPARROWS I HAVE SEEN CHAFFINCHES,BLUE TITS,COAL TITS AND GREAT TITS. IN THE PAST I HAVE SEEN MANY SMALL WILD ANIMALS ALONG THE SIDE OF THE STREAM-HEDGEHOGS, RABBITS AND HARES.I ALSO SAW ONE SMALL VOLE.
